option.value: {"/Volumes/Data/KitabKuningDigitalNew/Bidaayatul-Hidayah":"{\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Activity/ActivityInformation.java\":\"This file appears to be an Android activity that displays a tab layout with three fragments: \\\"How to Buy\\\", \\\"Payment\\\", and \\\"Contact Us\\\". It does not contain any explicit classes or functions, but rather uses the `PreferenceActivity` class and its associated methods to manage the application\\u0027s settings.\\n\\n`ActivitySetting`: This activity class is responsible for displaying and managing the application\\u0027s settings, including the ability to toggle the dark mode theme.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Retrieves the user\\u0027s preference for the dark mode theme from the shared preferences.\\n3. The `!important` declaration is used to ensure that these styles take precedence over any other styles that may be applied to the `h2` element.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Adapter/AdapterChannelYoutube.java\":\"This file contains an Android adapter class for a RecyclerView that displays a list of YouTube channels.\\n\\n`AdapterChannelYoutube`: This class is an adapter for a RecyclerView that displays a list of YouTube channels, including the channel name, location, and a thumbnail image.\\n\\n`ViewHolder`: This class is a holder for the views in each item of the RecyclerView, including the channel name, location, and thumbnail image.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: This function creates a new `ViewHolder` instance for each item in the RecyclerView.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: This function binds the data for a specific item in the RecyclerView to the corresponding views in the `ViewHolder`.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: This function returns the number of items in the data set.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Activity/ActivityDetailKitabSliderBackup.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `ActivityDetailKitabSliderBackup` class and its associated functions. The class is responsible for displaying the details of a Kitab (book) in a slider-based layout, including the title, content, and various interactive features such as text-to-speech, sharing, and reporting.\\n\\n`ActivityDetailKitabSliderBackup`: This class is responsible for displaying the details of a Kitab (book) in a slider-based layout, including the title, content, and various interactive features.\\n\\n`SectionsPagerAdapter`: This class is responsible for managing the fragments displayed in the ViewPager.\\n\\n`PlaceholderFragment`: This class is responsible for creating and managing the individual fragments displayed in the ViewPager.\\n\\n`speak`: This function is responsible for using the TextToSpeech engine to read aloud the content of the Kitab.\\n\\n`loadBanner`: This function is responsible for loading and displaying a banner advertisement in the activity.\\n\\n`getAdSize`: This function is responsible for determining the appropriate size for the banner advertisement based on the device\\u0027s screen size.\\n\\n`onCreateOptionsMenu`: This function is responsible for inflating the menu options for the activity.\\n\\n`onOptionsItemSelected`: This function is responsible for handling the user\\u0027s interactions with the menu options, such as searching, navigating to the next or previous match, and clearing the search.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Utilities/RecyclerItemClickListener.java\":\"This file contains a single class `RecyclerItemClickListener` that implements the `RecyclerView.OnItemTouchListener` interface to handle click events on items in a `RecyclerView`.\\n\\n`RecyclerItemClickListener`: A class that listens for click events on items in a `RecyclerView` and notifies a listener when an item is clicked.\\n\\n`onItemClick`: A function that is called when an item in the `RecyclerView` is clicked, and it notifies the listener of the click event.\\n\\n`onInterceptTouchEvent`: A function that intercepts touch events on the `RecyclerView` and determines whether to notify the listener of a click event.\\n\\n`onTouchEvent`: A function that is called when a touch event occurs on the `RecyclerView`, but it does not do anything in this implementation.\\n\\n`onRequestDisallowInterceptTouchEvent`: A function that is called when the parent view requests that the touch event be disallowed, but it does not do anything in this implementation.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/html/success_login.html\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is a simple HTML document that displays a welcome message and the contact information for a person named Iwan Purnama. The document includes the person\\u0027s name, contact phone numbers, email address, and BBM ID.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Fragment/FragmentInfoTab3_ContactUs.java\":\"This file contains a single class `FragmentInfoTab3_ContactUs` which is a `Fragment` that displays a contact form and a WhatsApp chat button. The class has the following functions:\\n\\n`onCreateView`: Inflates the fragment\\u0027s layout, sets up the contact form and WhatsApp chat button, and loads a web page in a WebView.\\n`myWebClient`: A custom `WebViewClient` that handles various events related to the WebView, such as page loading, URL loading, and error handling.\\n\\nThe file overall provides a contact form and a WhatsApp chat button within a Fragment, allowing users to send an email or initiate a WhatsApp chat with the app\\u0027s support team.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/html/success_register.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML document that displays a message to a user who has registered as an agent for GP Mandiri. The document does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a simple message with some formatting.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n1. Sets the character encoding to UTF-8.\\n2. Displays a message to the user, informing them that they have successfully registered as an agent for GP Mandiri.\\n3. Provides a message to the user, instructing them to log in before placing an order.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Utilities/Config.java\":\"This file contains a single class named `Config` that defines various static string constants used throughout the application.\\n\\n`Config`: A class that defines various static string constants used in the application, such as API URLs, table names, and query parameters.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Activity/IntroActivity.java\":\"This file contains the `IntroActivity` class and several functions within it. Here\\u0027s a summary of each:\\n\\n`IntroActivity`: This class is responsible for displaying an introduction screen when the app is launched for the first time.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function is called when the activity is created. It checks if the app is being launched for the first time and either displays the introduction screen or launches the main screen.\\n\\n`onActivityResult(int, int, Intent)`: This function is called when the introduction screen is completed, and it handles the user\\u0027s choices and launches the main screen.\\n\\n`launchHomeScreen()`: This function launches the main screen of the app.\\n\\n`introductionPage()`: This function sets up the slides and content for the introduction screen, including images and descriptions.\\n\\nOverall, this file is responsible for handling the initial launch of the app and displaying an introduction screen to the user if it\\u0027s their first time using the app.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Adapter/AdapterTokoMitra.java\":\"This file contains an Android adapter class for a RecyclerView that displays a list of shops or stores.\\n\\n`AdapterTokoMitra`: This class is responsible for providing the data and views for the RecyclerView that displays a list of shops or stores.\\n\\n`ViewHolder`: This inner class is used to hold the views for each item in the RecyclerView.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: This function is responsible for creating the ViewHolder instances for each item in the RecyclerView.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: This function is responsible for binding the data to the views in the ViewHolder for each item in the RecyclerView.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: This function returns the number of items in the data set.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/html/profile.html\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is a simple HTML document that provides information about a company called CV. GP Mandiri, which is a traditional herbal medicine company. The document includes the company\\u0027s vision and mission statements, as well as a brief history of the company\\u0027s origins and product development.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/style.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet that defines the styles for a web page. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets the styles for various HTML elements.\\n\\n`body`: Sets the background color of the entire web page to white.\\n\\n`h1`: Defines the styles for the main heading, including making the text bold, black, and 20 pixels in size.\\n\\n`@font-face`: Defines several custom font families that can be used throughout the web page, including \\\"AlQalamQuranMajeedWeb\\\", \\\"noorehira\\\", \\\"quran_majeed\\\", \\\"nefel_adeti\\\", \\\"traditional_arabic\\\", and \\\"arab_kemenag\\\".\\n\\n`h2`: Defines the styles for the secondary headings, including making the text normal weight, 20 pixels in size, right-aligned, with a line height of 2.0, and right-to-left direction.\\n\\n`p`: Defines the styles for the paragraph text, including making the text 16 pixels in size, left-aligned, and using the \\\"nefel_adeti\\\" font family.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Adapter/AdapterListAbout.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `AdapterListAbout`, which is an implementation of the `ArrayAdapter` class in Android. The purpose of this class is to provide a custom adapter for a list view, which displays a list of items with a title, subtitle, and an associated image.\\n\\n`AdapterListAbout`: This class extends the `ArrayAdapter` class and is used to populate a list view with custom items, each containing a title, subtitle, and an image.\\n\\n`getView(int position, View view, ViewGroup parent)`: This method is overridden from the `ArrayAdapter` class and is responsible for creating and populating the view for each item in the list view.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/style_big.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet that defines styles for various HTML elements and imports custom fonts. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets the styles for different elements.\\n\\n`h1`: Defines the styles for the top-level heading, including font weight, color, and size.\\n\\n`@font-face`: Imports several custom font families, including \\\"AlQalamQuranMajeedWeb\\\", \\\"noorehira\\\", \\\"quran_majeed\\\", \\\"nefel_adeti\\\", \\\"traditional_arabic\\\", and \\\"arab_kemenag\\\".\\n\\n`h2`: Defines the styles for the second-level heading, including font weight, size, text alignment, line height, and direction.\\n\\n`p`: Defines the styles for paragraphs, including font size, text alignment, and font family.\\n\\nOverall, this CSS file sets the visual styles for a web page, including custom font choices and formatting for different types of content.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/font_quran_majeed.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) code snippet that defines the styles for an HTML element with the `h2` tag. The `!important` declaration is used to ensure that these styles take precedence over any other styles that may be applied to the `h2` elements.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/font_trad_arabic.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) code snippet that defines the styles for an HTML element with the `h2` tag. for the paragraphs, including making the text 20 pixels in size, left-aligned, using the \\\"nefel_adeti\\\" font family, and white in color.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Activity/ActivityGridViewList.java\":\"This file contains a single class `ActivityGridViewList` which is an `AppCompatActivity` that displays a grid view of books (Kitab) and provides various functionalities related to searching, displaying, and managing the books.\\n\\n`ActivityGridViewList`: An activity that displays a grid view of books and provides various functionalities related to searching, displaying, and managing the books.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: Initializes the activity, sets up the toolbar, retrieves the category ID from the intent, and loads the book data based on the category ID.\\n\\n`onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu)`: Inflates the menu and sets up the search functionality.\\n\\n`onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem)`: Handles the action bar item clicks, such as refreshing the database or deleting the data.\\n\\n`showSearchGridView(String)`: Displays the grid view of books based on the search query.\\n\\n`getDataKitab()`: Retrieves the book data from the cloud and saves it to the local database.\\n\\n`isOnline()`: Checks if the device is connected to the internet.\\n\\n`getFavorite()`: Retrieves the favorite books from the local database and displays them.\\n\\n`getRecent()`: Retrieves the recently read books from the local database and displays them.\\n\\n`loadBanner()`: Loads and displays a banner advertisement.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Model/TokoMitra.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `TokoMitra`, which represents a store or shop that is a partner or affiliate of the application. The class has four private member variables (`namaToko`, `imgToko`, `urlToko`, and `asalToko`) that store the name, image, URL, and origin of the store, respectively. The class also provides getter and setter methods for each of these member variables.\\n\\n`TokoMitra`: A class that represents a store or shop that is a partner or affiliate of the application.\\n\\n`getNamaToko()`: Returns the name of the store.\\n`setNamaToko(String namaToko)`: Sets the name of the store.\\n`getImgToko()`: Returns the image of the store.\\n`setImgToko(String imgToko)`: Sets the image of the store.\\n`getUrlToko()`: Returns the URL of the store.\\n`setUrlToko(String urlToko)`: Sets the URL of the store.\\n`getAsalToko()`: Returns the origin of the store.\\n`setAsalToko(String asalToko)`: Sets the origin of the store.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/html/success_order.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML document that displays a message to the user indicating that their order has been received by the system and that they should check their email for the invoice. There are no classes or functions defined in this file.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n1. Sets the character encoding to UTF-8.\\n2. Displays a message to the user indicating that their order has been received.\\n3. Instructs the user to check their email for the invoice.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/style_tv.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet that defines styles for various HTML elements. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets the styles for different elements such as headings, paragraphs, and custom font faces.\\n\\n`h1`: Sets the font weight, color, and size for the top-level heading.\\n\\n`@font-face`: Defines several custom font faces that can be used throughout the document, including \\\"AlQalamQuranMajeedWeb\\\", \\\"noorehira\\\", \\\"nefel_adeti\\\", \\\"quran_majeed\\\", \\\"traditional_arabic\\\", and \\\"arab_kemenag\\\".\\n\\n`h2`: Sets the font weight, size, alignment, line height, and direction for the second-level heading.\\n\\n`p`: Sets the font size, alignment, and font family for paragraphs.\\n\\nOverall, this CSS file is used to style the content of an HTML document, with a focus on using custom font faces and setting the appearance of headings and paragraphs.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Database/DBHelper.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `DBHelper`, which is a subclass of `SQLiteOpenHelper`. The purpose of this class is to create and manage a SQLite database for storing information about \\\"Kitab\\\" (a type of Islamic book).\\n\\n`DBHelper`: This class is responsible for creating and managing a SQLite database for storing information about \\\"Kitab\\\".\\n\\n`onCreate(SQLiteDatabase db)`: This function is called when the database is created, and it executes the SQL statement to create the \\\"tbl_kitab\\\" table.\\n\\n`onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db, int oldVersion, int newVersion)`: This function is called when the database version is upgraded, but it is currently empty.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Model/ChannelYoutube.java\":\"This file defines a single class `ChannelYoutube` that represents a YouTube channel with information about the channel\\u0027s name, image, URL, and origin.\\n\\n`ChannelYoutube`: A class that represents a YouTube channel with information about the channel\\u0027s name, image, URL, and origin.\\n\\n`ChannelYoutube(String namaToko, String imgToko, String urlToko, String asalToko)`: A constructor that initializes the fields of the `ChannelYoutube` class.\\n\\n`getNamaToko()`: Returns the name of the YouTube channel.\\n`setNamaToko(String namaToko)`: Sets the name of the YouTube channel.\\n`getImgToko()`: Returns the image of the YouTube channel.\\n`setImgToko(String imgToko)`: Sets the image of the YouTube channel.\\n`getUrlToko()`: Returns the URL of the YouTube channel.\\n`setUrlToko(String urlToko)`: Sets the URL of the YouTube channel.\\n`getAsalToko()`: Returns the origin of the YouTube channel.\\n`setAsalToko(String asalToko)`: Sets the origin of the YouTube channel.\",\"/app/google-services.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON configuration file for a Firebase project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather provides information about the project, including the project number, Firebase URL, project ID, storage bucket, and various client configurations for different Android applications associated with the project.\\n\\nThe key information in this file includes:\\n\\n`project_info`: Provides high-level details about the Firebase project.\\n`client`: Contains information about the different Android applications that are integrated with the Firebase project, including their package names, client IDs, and API keys.\\n`services`: Describes the various services enabled for the Firebase project, such as analytics, app invites, and ads.\\n\\nOverall, this file is used to configure the Firebase integration for multiple Android applications that are part of the same Firebase project.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/html/how_to_buy.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML document that provides information about a technology division of an organization called Baitul Qur`an Daarul Hijrah. The document does not contain any classes or functions, but rather provides a description of the organization\\u0027s work, the sources of the content in their applications, and a request for users to report any inappropriate advertisements. The document also includes contact information for the organization.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Adapter/AdapterGridViewIsiKitab.java\":\"This file contains the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`AdapterGridViewIsiKitab`: This class is a custom adapter for a GridView that displays a list of Kitab (book) items.\\n\\n`getCount()`: This function returns the count of Kitab items in the adapter.\\n\\n`getItem(int position)`: This function returns the item at the specified position, but it always returns `null`.\\n\\n`getItemId(int position)`: This function returns the item ID at the specified position, but it always returns `0`.\\n\\n`getView(int position, View convertView, ViewGroup parent)`: This function creates or reuses a view for the Kitab item at the specified position and sets the appropriate data and styles based on the user\\u0027s preferences.\\n\\n`ViewHolder`: This is a static inner class that holds references to the views within the adapter\\u0027s item layout.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides a custom adapter for displaying a list of Kitab items in a GridView, with the ability to customize the font and size of the text based on the user\\u0027s preferences.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Fragment/FragmentInfoTab2_Payment.java\":\"This file contains a single class `FragmentInfoTab2_Payment` which is a `Fragment` that displays a WebView with a payment-related HTML page.\\n\\n`FragmentInfoTab2_Payment`: A Fragment that displays a WebView with a payment-related HTML page.\\n\\n`onCreateView`: Inflates the fragment\\u0027s layout, sets up the WebView with various settings, and loads the payment-related HTML page.\\n\\n`myWebClient`: A custom WebViewClient that handles various events related to the WebView, such as page loading, URL loading, and error handling.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/night-style_tablet.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet that defines the styles for a web page. Here\\u0027s a summary of the styles defined in the file:\\n\\n`body`: Sets the background color of the entire web page to a dark gray.\\n\\n`h1`: Defines the styles for the main heading, including making the text bold, white in color, and 40 pixels in size.\\n\\n`@font-face`: Defines several custom font families that can be used in the web page, including \\\"AlQalamQuranMajeedWeb\\\", \\\"noorehira\\\", \\\"quran_majeed\\\", \\\"nefel_adeti\\\", \\\"traditional_arabic\\\", and \\\"arab_kemenag\\\".\\n\\n`h2`: Defines the styles for the secondary headings, including making the text normal weight, 40 pixels in size, right-aligned, with a line height of 2.0, and right-to-left direction, all in white color.\\n\\n`p`: Defines the styles for the paragraphs, including making the text 34 pixels in size, left-aligned, using the \\\"nefel_adeti\\\" font family, and white in color.\\n\\nOverall, this CSS file sets the styles for a web page with a dark gray background, white text, and custom font families for the headings and paragraphs.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Utilities/UtilitiyGridView.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`setListViewHeightBasedOnChildren`: This function sets the height of a GridView based on the height of its child views, ensuring that the GridView displays all its items without any clipping or scrolling.\\n\\nThe file appears to be a utility class that provides a method to adjust the height of a GridView to fit its content, which can be useful when working with GridViews in Android development.\",\"/app/src/main/assets/font_arab_kemenag.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) code snippet that defines the styles for an HTML element with the `h2` tag. The code does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets the following styles:\\n\\n`h2`: This CSS rule applies styles to all `h2` elements in the document. It sets the text alignment to right, the font family to \\u0027arab_kemenag\\u0027, and the line height to 2.0. The `!important` declaration is used to ensure that these styles take precedence over any other styles that may be applied to the `h2` elements.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Database/DataSource.java\":\"This file contains a single class `DataSource` that provides an interface to interact with a SQLite database for storing and retrieving data related to Kitab (a type of book).\\n\\n`DataSource`: This class manages the connection to the SQLite database, provides methods to save, retrieve, and search for Kitab data, and update the favorite and recent status of Kitab entries.\\n\\n`saveKitab(ArrayList\\u003cKitab\\u003e kitabArrayList)`: Saves a list of Kitab objects to the database.\\n`getItemKitab(int idTabel)`: Retrieves a list of Kitab objects with the specified table ID.\\n`getAllData()`: Retrieves a list of all Kitab objects in the database.\\n`getFavoriteData()`: Retrieves a list of Kitab objects that are marked as favorites.\\n`getRecentData()`: Retrieves a list of Kitab objects that are marked as recently accessed.\\n`getSearchText(String textSearch)`: Retrieves a list of Kitab objects that match the specified search text.\\n`deleteTableKitab()`: Deletes all Kitab entries from the database.\\n`updateFavorite(long id, int intFav)`: Updates the favorite status of a Kitab entry.\\n`resetRecent()`: Resets the recent status of all Kitab entries.\\n`updateRecent(long id, int recent)`: Updates the recent status of a Kitab entry.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/daarulhijrah/kitabkuning/Activity/MainActivity.java\":\"This file appears to be the main activity class for an Android application.
